    Poland's Krakow

    Go Beyond visits The Slavic capital of art and culture

    13th – 20th May 2025

    What's to get excited about!

    When we think of Poland what do we think of? Chopin? John–Paul II? Vodka?

    Well, we would like to take you on a journey of discovery into one of Poland’s most famous cities, Krakow. This beautiful city is situated on the mighty Vistula River, in the south of Poland, near the Czech Republic border.

    Krakow is known for its beautiful and well-preserved historic centre, consisting of Gothic, Renaissance and Baroque architecture. The historic centre, which includes the Old Town and the Main Market Square, was included as the first of its kind on the list of UNESCO World Heritage Sites in 1978.

    On this memorable trip you will cruise along the Vistula, explore the old town and discover Wawal Castle.

    No trip to this part of Poland would be complete without visiting the sombre site of Auschwitz, the former concentration camp and now a museum acting as a symbol of the Holocaust.

    We will also visit Oskar Schindler’s famous Enamel Factory, the factory that saved 1200 workers from being sent to the concentration camps. Come and joins us in this wonderous place, steeped in rich history and most certainly, a place you’ll never forget!

    Where you'll be staying...

    The Hotel Galicya in Krakow provides comfort and relaxation in a great location close to all of Krakow’s attractions. Also known for it’s super friendly staff who always have a smile for you.

    Food, glorious food!

    The elegant Galicya Restaurant invites you on a culinary journey through the flavours of Europe and old Polish cuisine in a modern setting.

    What you'll experience...

    We will meet at a London airport and you will be supported on the flight to the John Paul II International Airport in Kraków. Our mini-buses will take you on the 40-minute drive to the hotel.

    Our mini-buses will take you on the 2 hour and 30-minute drive to the accommodation, with stops along the way.

    Your holiday will include the following:

  • 7 night, full board accommodation.
  • All entrance fees to all activities and sites.
  • Airport transfers and transport in and around Poland.
  • Return flight from London to Krakow, accompanied and supported by our Go Beyond team.
  • A ratio of 2 guests to 1 Go Beyond support staff member.
  • Support from our Go Beyond team during the holiday.

    • Accessiblility and Inclusion

    Inclusion is important to us so we strive, whenever possible, to make our holidays accessible to all.

    If you wish to discuss your specific access requirement for any of our holidays, please contact us at your earliest convenience and we will do everything we can to welcome you to the Go Beyond Holidays experience.

    Holiday name
    Poland's Krakow

    Date
    13th – 20th May 2025

    Nights
    7 nights

    Accommodation
    Hotel Galicya

    Food
    All food will be catered for by the hotel

    Price
    £3340 (All Inclusive)

    Day 1
    Travel from London to Krakow, travel up to our accommodation via mini bus, settle in.

    Day 2
    Vistula Boat cruise

    Day 3
    Visit Wawal Castle and guided tour of Krakow old town

    Day 4
    Visit Auschwitz Memorial and Museum

    Day 5
    Rest Day

    Day 6
    Visit Oskar Schindler’s Factory

    Day 7
    Visit the Aviation museum, Lego museum and Arcade Museum

    Day 8
    Drive back to Krakow Airport for flight back to London.
